intro: Erucastrum griquense, commonly known as the Grootfontein cress, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant has small, lobed leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It is part of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and medicinal plants. Erucastrum griquense is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its environment.
